definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: q.v.), cf. Ez Eze 25:9, [[שׁער]] of temple (- court) Ez Eze 46:12 (c. [[ל]], pers.), Ps 118:19 (id.), city Is 26:2, obj. om. De 20:11, 2Ki 15:16; window, [[חַלּוֹן]], 2Ki 13:17, 2Ki 13:17, [[אֲרֻבּוֹת הַשָׁמַיִם]] (by ´[[י]] sending rain) Ge 8:6(J), Mal 3:10; city Je 13:19, [[פְּתוּחָה]] Jos 8:17 (JE); abs. [[ל]] 2Ch 6:40 (by zeugma), 2Ch 7:15 (all of ´[[י]]'s favour); open hand, in giving De 15:8, De 15:11 (c, [[ל]] pers., + inf. abs.), of ´[[י]] Ps 104:28, Ps 145:16; book Ne 8:5, Ne 8:5, letter Ne 6:5; open river (channel) Is 41:18 (of ´[[י]]), rock, letting out water, Ps 105:41 (id.); open sword, = draw it Ez Eze 21:28, Ps 37:14; of root [[שָׁרְשִׁי פָתוּחַ אֱלֵי־מָָיִם]] Job 29:19, i.e. with no obstacle intervening.—[[תִּפְתַּח אֶרֶץ]] Is 45:8 is dub.; verb not elsewhere intrans.; Du Che:Hpt Marti prop. definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. [[נִפְתַּח]] Is 5:27, etc.; Impf. 3 ms. [[יִפָּתַח]] Ez Eze 24:27, [[יִפָּתֵָחַ]] Eze 44:2 +, etc.; Inf. cstr. [[הִפָּתֵחַ]] Is 51:14; Pt. [[נִפְתָּח]]Zec 13:1; —be opend, of girdle Is 5:27 (i.e. loosened), cf. of captive Is 51:14, and, of calamity, Je 1:14 be let loose (c. [[עַל]] pers.) ; gates Na 2:7, Na 3:13 (of land, thrown open to ([[ל]]) enemy), Ez Eze 44:2, Eze 46:1, Eze 46:1, Ne 7:3; impers. of man shut in by God Job 12:14; of windows of heaven Ge 7:11 (P), cf. Is 24:18 (of future destruction); the heavens themselves Ez Eze 1:1(for visions); fountain Zec 13:1; wine (-skin, c. neg.) Job 32:19; mouth, in speech, Eze 33:22; ears Is 35:5.
free, i.e. ungird, camels Ge 24:32 (J): loins of kings Is 45:1 (i.e. disarm them); set free, c. sf. pers. Ps 105:20, Je 40:4 (c. [[מִן]]); c. acc. [[בְּנֵי תְמוּתָה]] Ps 102:21.

loosen (and remove) sack-cloth Is 20:2 (c. [[מֵעַל]] ), Ps 30:12; armour 1Ki 20:11 (obj. om.; opp. [[חָגַר]]) ; bonds Job 12:18, Ps 116:16, cf. Is 58:6, Job 39:5; cord Job 30:11, Job 38:11; loosen ground Is 28:24 (in tillage ; cf. Vogelst:Land wrirthschaft 38, As. puttû).

open gates Is 60:11, doors Job 41:6 (fig. of crocodile's jaws); ear Is 48:8 (rd. prob. either [[פִּתַּחְתִּי]], [[פָּתַחְתִּי]] [LXX Du Marti], or [[נִפְתְּחָה]] [Gr Che Kit in Di] ; buds Ct So 7:13 (of blossom; obj. om.; or intrans., as sts. Ar. fatah.a v. Dozy).
